name: Kilimanjaro
hint: Africa's highest peak, a free-standing volcanic mountain in Tanzania near the Kenyan border

name: Mount Kenya
hint: Africa's second-highest mountain, an extinct volcano in central Kenya straddling the equator

name: Ras Dashen
hint: The highest mountain in Ethiopia, located in the Simien Mountains of the northern highlands

name: Mount Stanley
hint: The highest peak of the Rwenzori Mountains on the Uganda-DRC border, also called Margherita Peak

name: Mount Meru
hint: Tanzania's second-highest mountain, an active volcano near Arusha, often used to acclimatize for Kilimanjaro

name: Toubkal
hint: The highest mountain in North Africa and the Atlas Mountains, located in Morocco

name: Mount Cameroon
hint: The highest mountain in West Africa, an active volcano near the coast of Cameroon

name: Thabana Ntlenyana
hint: The highest point in the Drakensberg range and in southern Africa, located in Lesotho

name: Mount Elgon
hint: An extinct shield volcano on the border of Uganda and Kenya, with one of the world's largest calderas

name: Simien Mountains
hint: A UNESCO World Heritage mountain range in northern Ethiopia, home to the endemic gelada baboon
